byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The fatal attack by a group of men on a woman named Farkhunda, who was falsely accused of burning a Quran, has galvanized women’s activists in the country.

headline.print_headline: Tears Replace Cheers in Re-enactment of Afghan Woman’s Killing
headline.main: Tears Replace Cheers in Re-enactment of Farkhunda’s Killing in Afghanistan

snippet: The fatal attack by a group of men on a woman named Farkhunda, who was falsely accused of burning a Quran, has galvanized women’s activists in the country.
abstract: Kabul Journal; brutal murder of Islamic law student Farkhunda, who was beaten to death by angry mob in Kabul after being falsely accused of burning Quran, has galvanized women's rights activists in Afghanistan; coalition of rights groups, concerned that no formal charges have been filed in case one month later, stages re-enactment of killing.
